owl:Ontology.dc:creator: Harshvardhan J. Pandit
owl:Ontology.dc:description: The General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) is comprised of several articles, each with points that refer to specific concepts. The general convention of referring to these points and concepts is to quote the specific article or point using a human-readable reference. This ontology provides a way to refer to the points within the GDPR using the EurLex ontology published by the European Publication Office. It also defines the concepts defined, mentioned, and requried by the GDPR using the Simple Knowledge Organization System (SKOS) ontology.
owl:Ontology.dc:title: GDPRtEXT
owl:Ontology.terms:abstract: The General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) defines legal obligations over the use of personal data by organisations. This ontology aims to identify and model such terms and obligations as an OWL vocabulary and to directly link the terms to their occurence, usage, and influence in the GDPR text.
owl:Ontology.terms:creator: http://purl.org/adaptcentre/people/HJP
owl:Ontology.terms:description: This ontology extends the canonical (official) GDPR text with additional annotations
owl:Ontology.rdfs:comment: This is an ontology to represent GDPR text as a set of RDF resources
owl:Ontology.rdfs:label: GDPR text EXTensions
owl:Ontology.rdfs:seeAlso: Bartolini, C., Muthuri, R., & Santos, C. (2015, November). Using ontologies to model data protection requirements in workflows. In JSAI International Symposium on Artificial Intelligence (pp. 233-248). Springer, Cham.

owl:AnnotationProperty.rdfs:comment: It signifies that two concepts are related within the context of the GDPR.
owl:AnnotationProperty.rdfs:label: involves

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: indicates the legal resource has the Article
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: has Article

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: indicates the legal resource has the Chapter
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: has Chapter

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: indicates that the legal resource has the referenced citation
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: has Citation

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: indicates the legal resource has the Point
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: has Point

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: indicates the legal resource has the Recital
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: has Recital

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: indicates the legal resource has the Section
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: has Section

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: indicates the legal resource has the SubPoint
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: has SubPoint

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: represents a legal resource subdivision to be part of a article
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: is part of Article

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: represents a legal resource subdivision to be part of a chapter
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: is part of Chapter

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: represents a legal resource subdivision to be part of a point
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: is part of Point

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: represents a legal resource subdivision to be part of a section
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: is part of Section

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: The principle of accountability states that the controller shall be responsible for, and be able to demonstrate compliance with the processing of personal data as defined by the justifications permissible under the GDPR
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Principle of Accountability

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: The principle of accuracy states that personal data must be accurate and, where necessary, kept up to date; every reasonable step must be taken to ensure that personal data that are inaccurate, having regard to the purposes for which they are processed, are erased or rectified without delay.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Principle of Accuracy

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: The data subject can exercise the right to restrict processing of their personal data when the accuracy of personal data is contested
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Accuracy is contested

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: This obligation specifies that the collection of (or collected) personal data should in an accurate form - i.e. the personal data should be accurate.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Accurate Collection

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: An Activity signifies some process(es) or step(s) towards specific deed(s), action(s), function(s), or sphere(s) of action.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Activity

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Only the personal data adequat for required processing should be maintained
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Adequate for processing

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: The seal or certification does not reduce or impact the responsiblity of the controller or processor for compliance with the GDPR
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Adherence

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Data is termed to be anonymous if it cannot be connected or associated with individual person or persons that have provided or are associated with it.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Anonymous Data

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: These are the obligations for Processors over appointing sub-processors
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Appointing Sub-Processors

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: These are the obligations specified by the GDPR for the appointment of Processors by Controllers.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Appointment of Processors

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: An activity where personal data is archived
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Archive Data

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Article in GDPR text
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Article

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Processors must assist Controllers in complying with the various rights provided by the GDPR to data subjects which can be exercised at any time.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Assist in complying with rights

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: This type of processing involves automated processing that does decision making having significant effects on the data subject.
Automated decision making with significant effect
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Automatic decision making with significant effect

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: This is automated processing of data subject's personal data.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Automated Processing

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: This obligation states that the data subject should be able to withdraw the consent as easily as it was to give it.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Can be withdrawn easily

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A certification pertaining to GDPR compliance
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Certification

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A Certification Body is an entity that can award/issue/renew a certification pertaining to compliance towards the GDPR.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Certification Body

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Chapter in GDPR text
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Chapter

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Citation in GDPR text
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Citation

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Obtaining consent must provide clear explanations of the processing involved over the personal data
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Clear explanation

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A Code of Conduct for the purpose of specifying the application of GDPR which may be monitored, evaluated, or processed by a third party appointed by the organisation.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Code of Conduct

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Specifies collection mechanism used to collect personal data
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Collection Mechanism

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Collection of Personal Data is an Activity that deals with acquiring data subject's personal data through some model of interaction.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Collection of Personal Data

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Represents the act of complying with the obligations and actions specified by the GDPR.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Compliance

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: The processor has an obligation to comply with the controller's instructions
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Compliance with Controller's instructions

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: GDPR mentions some conditions or criterion for the creation and issuing of seals and certifications pertaining to GDPR compliance
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Awarding Seals and Certifications

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: This type of processing involves matching data subject's identity or personal data in different datasets.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Confirming or matching datasets

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Consent in the context of the GDPR refers to the assent or agreement by the data subject in relation to their personal data for the proposed processing activities associated with one or more organisations.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Consent

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: An activity involving data subject's consent.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Consent Activity

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: The purpose of new processing should take the context of how the original data was collected into consideration
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Context of data collection

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: The lawful basis for processing personal data is provided through a contract with the data subject.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Contract with Data Subject

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: The natural or legal person, public authority, agency or other body which, alone or jointly with others, determines the purposes and means of the processing of personal data.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Controller

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: These obligations specify the accountability of the Controller.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Controller Accountability

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: The data subjects were not notified about the data breach because the controller had already taken action regarding the data breach.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Controller has taken action

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: These are the obligations specified by the GDPR as being specifically the responsbility of the Controller.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Controller Obligation

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A natural or legal person established in the Union who, designated by the controllerin writing, represents the controller with regard to their respective obligations under the GDPR.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Controller Representative

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: These obligations specify the responsiblity of the Controller
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Controller Responsibility

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: This obligation specifies the Controller/Processor must co-operate with the Data Protection Authority (DPA).
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Co-operate with DPA

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Personal data related to criminal convictions and offences.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Crime data

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Cross-border data transfer refers to data transfer crossing the boundaries of EU (legislative) region.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Cross-border Transfer

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: The Data Protection Authority (DPA) is a public institution responsible for monitoring the application of data protection laws.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: DPA

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: The Data Protection Officer (DPO) is an individual(s) appointed by the organisation to monitor compliance and assist in complying with the GDPR.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: DPO

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: These are the obligations specified for the Data Protection Office (DPO) within the GDPR
owl:Class.rdfs:label: DPO Obligation

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A generic term to refer to Data.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Data

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: An activity involving personal data of data subject(s).
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Data Activity

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A data breach is the intentional or unintentional release of secure or private/confidential information to an untrusted environment.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Data Breach

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: The principle of data minimisation states that personal data must be adequate, relevant and limited to what is necessary in relation to the purposes for which they are processed.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Principle of Data Minimisation

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: The data subject can exercise the right to restrict processing of their personal data when the personal data is no longer required for the original purpose it was collected under
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Data no longer needed for original purpose

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: This obligation requires Controllers to follow data protection by design and by default.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Data protection by design and default

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: These are obligations regarding security of data managed by the Controllers.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Data Security

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: An individual or entity to whom their personal data relates.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Data Subject

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: The obligation or activity coult not be completed because the data was inferred or derived, and therefore did not come from the data subject or other sources.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Data inferred or derived

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: The act of demonstrating consent is an activity whereby previously acquired consent is provided as sufficient justification for processing activities involving data subject's personal information.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Demonstrating Consent

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Type of Marketing that reaches data subjects directly by communications directly addressed to the data subject.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Direct Marketing

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Lawful basis for processing is provided by Employment Law
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Employment Law

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A general term for any institution, company, corporation, partnership, government agency, university, or any other organization including individuals.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Entity

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: An activity that erases data
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Erase Data

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: The right of erasure applies when the data subject withdraws given consent
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Erase if conesnt was withdrawn

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: The right to erasure applies where data is no longer needed for original purposes for which it was collected
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Erase if no longer needed for original purpose

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Whether the proposed activity involves the evaluation of the data subject.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Evaluation of data subjects

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Exceptions associated with compliance for reporting data breach to the affected data subjects.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Exceptions on reporting data breach

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Exclusions and Exemptions provided by the GDPR for not complying with the specified obligations.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Exlcusions and Exceptions

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Lawful basis for processing is provided by National Law
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Exempted by National Law

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: The request or activity could not or was not completed because there was no sufficient proof of the data subject's identity.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Exempted without identity

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: The activity represents exercising of rights provided by GDPR by the data subject.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Exercise Rights

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: The purpose of new processing should take into context the existence of appropriate safeguards
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Existence of safeguards

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: This obligation specifies that the collected (or collection) of personal data should be for/with explicit purposes.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Explicit Purpose

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: These are the factors stated by the GDPR for Impact Assessment.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Factors for Impact Assessment

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: The stated obligation could not be completed as it concerns rights protection.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Rights protection

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: GDPR obligation that specifies consent must be freely given by the data subject for it to be valid.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Freely given

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Personal data relating to the inherited or acquired genetic characteristics of a natural person which result from the analysis of a biological sample from the natural person in question, in particular chromosomal, deoxyribonucleic acid (DNA) or ribonucleic acid (RNA) analysis, or from the analysis of another element enabling equivalent information to be obtained.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Genetic Data

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Given Consent refers specifically to the form of consent given by the data subject in relation to their personal data and the proposed usage by activities.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Given Consent

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: The data subjects were not notified about the data breach because the harm was deemed to be remote.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Harm was remote

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Personal data related to the physical or mental health of a natural person, including the provision of health care services, which reveal information about his or her health status.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Health data

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Lawful basis if provided by the GDPR for processing related to historic, statistical, or scientific purposes.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Historic, Statistical, or Scientific purposes

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Retention of personal data should be identifiable for the requried processing
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Identifiable for required processing

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Activity where the data subject is explicitly identified through direct or indirect means.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Identification of Data Subject

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: The right to access personal data also includes information about whether and where the controller is processing the data subject's personal data
owl:Class.rdfs:label: If and where Controller is processing

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: The activity wherein the controller carries out an assessment of the impact of the envisaged processing operations on the protection of personal data.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Impact Assessment

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: This obligation requires Controllers to implement the required technical measures necessary for compliance of the GDPR
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Implement technical measures

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: The processor must impose confidentiality agreements on its personnel in relation to handling of personal data
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Impose confidentiality obligations on personnel

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: The right to access personal data also includes information about automated processing that has significant effects on the data subject.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Information about automated processing with significant effects

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: The right to access personal data also includes information about the categories of recipients the data is shared with.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Information about categories of recipients

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: The right to access personal data also includes information about categories of data being processed
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Information about categories of data being processed

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: The right to access personal data also includes information about the existence of rights provided by the GDPR to the data subject
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Information about rights

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: The right to access personal data also includes information about the processing of personal data of the data subject
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Information about processing

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: The right to access personal data also includes information about the source of the personal data
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Information about data source

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: The right to access personal data also includes information about the storage period of the data subject's personal data
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Information about storage period

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: In case of conflict with the controller's intructions and the law, the processor must immediately inform the controller of this conflict
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Inform Controller of conflict with law

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: The right to basic information also provides data subject's with information about third parties involved in the processing.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Information about third parties

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: The information provided under the right to transparency should be concise
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Concise

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: The information provided under the right to transparency should be easily accessible
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Easily Accessible

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: The information provided under the right to transparency should be intelligible
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Intelligible

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: The information provided under the right to transparency should be transparent and clear (i.e. not umambigious or vague)
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Transparent

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: GDPR obligation that specifies consent must be informed for it be valid.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Informed

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: The principle of integrity and confidentiality states that personal data must be processed in a manner that ensures appropriate security of the personal data, including protection against unauthorised or unlawful processing and against accidental loss, destruction or damage, using appropriate technical or organisational measures.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Principle of Integrity and Confidentiality

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: The obligation or activity could not be completed as it was deemed to be impossible.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Is impossible

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A joint controller is two or more controllers jointly determine the purposes and means of processing.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Joint Controller

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Retained personal data must be kept up-to-date
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Kept up to date

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: The processing of personal data at a large scale of quantity or significant proportions.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Large scale processing

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: This provides the basis for lawful processing of personal data.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Lawful Basis

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: The principle of lawfulness, fairness, and transparency states that personal data must be processed lawfully, fairly and in a transparent manner in relation to the data subject.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Principle of Lawfulness, Fairness, and Transparency

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Lawful basis for processing is provided by legal claims.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Legal Claims

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Lawful basis for processing is covered by legal obligation(s).
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Legal Obligations

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Lawful basis for processing is provided through the legitimate interests pursued by the Controller or by a third party
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Legitimate Interests

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: This specifies that the collection (or collected) personal data should be used/specified to be used for legitimate purposes.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Legitimate purpose

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: These specify the liability of Joint Controllers, i.e. cases where more than one Controller share the responsiblity.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Liability of Joint-Controllers

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Personal data retained should be limited in its use only for the requried processing
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Limited for processing

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Whether there is a link between the new and old purposes of processing
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Lnk between new and old processing

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Lawful basis is provided through the data being publicly made available by the data subject
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Made Public

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: GDPR mandates the recording of data breaches and its effects.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Maintain Record of Breach

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: This obligation requires the Controller/Processor to maintain adequate records about their processing activities.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Maintain records for processing

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: The process or technique of promoting, selling, and distributing a product or service.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Marketing

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: The maximum validity for all seals and certifications should be 3 years from the date of issue.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Maximum validty 3 years

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Lawful basis for processing is provided by the GDPR for medical or diagnostics purposes pertaining to the data subject
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Medical or Diagnostics

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: The activity or process of overseeing an organisation's compliance.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Monitor Compliance

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: The stated obligation could not be completed as it concerns national security.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: National Security

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: The nature of the personal data involved, whether it is sensitive or confidential.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Nature of data involved

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: The right to access personal data should not incur any undue charge levied on the data subject for exercising their right
owl:Class.rdfs:label: No charges levied

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Lawful basis is provided by the GDPR for activities of/for not-for-profit organisations
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Not-for-profit organisation

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Consent should not be obtained from silence or inactivity of the data subject
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Not from silence or inactivity

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: This obligation specifies that the collected personal data should not be processed beyond the purpose for which it was originally collected without an updated consent for the proposed purposes.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Not further processed

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: The data subjects were not notified about the data breach because it required disproportionate efforts.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Notification requires disproportionate efforts

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Affected data subject's must be notified about the consequences of the data breach.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Notify consequences of breach

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Affected data subjects must be notified with the name and contact of the DPO responsible/handling for the data breach.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Notify about DPO

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Affected data subjects must be notified of the data breach and its effects.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Notify Data Subject of Breach

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Affect data subjets must be notified of the measures taken against the data breach.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Notify measures taken

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: These are the obligations specified by the GDPR. Following the obligations is necessary for compliance.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Obligation

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Collection of Personal Data is an Activity that deals with acquiring data subject's personal data through some model of interaction.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Obligation for data collection

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: These are the obligations specified by the GDPR for obtaining consent
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Obligation for obtaining consent

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: The act of getting a data subject's consent.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Obtaining Consent from Data Subject

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: The processor must only act on the intructions provided and documented by the controller
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Only act on Controller instructions

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: The activity was deemed to be outside the material scope of the GDPR.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Outside Material Scope

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Personal data means any information relating to an identified or identifiable natural person (data subject); an identifiable natural person is one who can be identified, directly or indirectly, in particular by reference to an identifier such as a name, an identification number, location data, an online identifier or to one or more factors specific to the physical, physiological, genetic, mental, economic, cultural or social identity of that natural person.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Personal Data

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Point in GDPR text
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Point

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: The possible consequences of the change in processing for the data subject
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Consequences for data subjects

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A Principle is a rule or standard defined by the GDPR which is essential to be followed for compliance
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Principle

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Privacy by Design is the approach of taking privacy into consideration throughout the whole planning and execution processes.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Privacy by Design

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Processing here refers to an Activity that acts on the Data Subject's personal information.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Processing

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: This type of processing involves data subjects that are vulnerable, such as children, or people with disabilities.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Processing affected or vulnerable individuals

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: The data subject can exercise the right to restrict processing of their personal data when the processing is unlawful
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Processing is unlawful

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: This involves processing involving sensitive personal data.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Processing sensitive data

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: This type of processing uses technologies that are new or have not yet been deemed to be fit or stable for usage.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Processing using untested technologies

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A natural or legal person, public authority, agency or other body which processes personal data on behalf of the controller.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Processor

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Signifies the agreement between Controller and Processors for processing of personal data
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Agreement between Processor and Controller

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: These are the obligations specified by the GDPR in the context of Processors
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Processor Obligations

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A natural or legal person established in the Union who, designated by the processor in writing, represents the processor with regard to their respective obligations under the GDPR.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Processor Representative

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: To propogate a data subject's right once they have been exercised to other third parties that are involved through the data subject's personal data.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Propogate rights to Third Parties

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Protection of data subject's personal data against accidental loss.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Protection against accidental loss

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Protection of data subject's personal data against damage to the data.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Protection against damage

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Protection of data subject's personal data against destruction of data.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Protection against destruction

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Protection of data subject's personal data against unlawful processing of data.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Protection against unlawful processing

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: The processor must provide the controller with the information necessary to demonstrate compliance
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Provide information for compliance

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: The right of data portability requries providing a copy of the data subject's personal data
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Provide copy of Personal Data

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Personal data that can no longer be attributed to a specific data subject without the use of additional information.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Pseudo-anonymous data

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Lawful basis is provided by the GDPR as being in the interest of the public
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Public Interest

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: The principle of purpose limitation states that personal data must be collected for specified, explicit and legitimate purposes and not further processed in a manner that is incompatible with those purposes; further processing for archiving purposes in the public interest, scientific or historical research purposes or statistical purposes shall, in accordance with Article 89(1) of the GDPR, not be considered to be incompatible with the initial purposes.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Principle of Purpose Limitation

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: These are the obligations over determining the new or changed purposes of processing
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Purpose of new processing

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Related to Regulation (EC) No. 45/2001
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Regulation (EC) No 45/2001

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Exempted as the GDPR does not apply to personal or household activity that does not have a professional or commercial activity associated with it.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Personal or Household activity

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Exempted as it involves areas covered by Directive (EU) 2016/680
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Covered by Directive (EU) 2016/680

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Personal data revealing racial or ethnic origin.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Racial origin data

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Regulation in GDPR text
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Regulation

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: This obligation requires Controllers to record the categories of data subjects and the personal data involved in processing/activities.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Categories of data subjects and personal data

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: This obligation requires Controllers to record the categories of recipients the personal data was shared with.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Record categories of recipients

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: This obligation requires Controllers to record the cross-border data transfers.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Record cross-border transfers

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: This obligation requires Controllers to record the data retention period of personal data.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Record data retention periods

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: This obligation requires Controllers to record the purpose of processing associated with personal data and the given consent.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Record purpose of processing

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: This obligation requires Controllers to record the measures taken to ensure adequate safety measures of personal data and the involved activities.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Record security measures

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: An activity that rectifies data
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Rectify Data

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Any inaccuracies or discrepancies in the retained data must be rectified
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Rectify Inaccuracies

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: The authority responsible for regulating data protection laws.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Regulatory Authority

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Any retained personal data must be relevant for subsiquent processing
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Relevant for processing

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: The act of reporting a data breach to entities mentioned within the GDPR. These are the Data Protection Authority (DPA), and in the case of Processors, the Controller they have an agreement with.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Report Data Breach

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: The occurence of a data breach must be reported to the Controller.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Report data breach to Controller

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: The occurence of a data breach must be reported to the Data Protection Authority (DPA) within 72 hours
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Report breach to DPA within 72 hours

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: The stated obligation or activity could not be completed as it requires disproportionate efforts to complete.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Requires disproportionate efforts

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Appointing a sub-processor requires the written consent of the controller specifying permission or consent
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Written consent of Controller

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: These provide restrictions on cross-border transfers for Processors
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Restrictions on cross-border transfers

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: These are the obligations specified by the GDPR on the retention of personal data
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Data Retention

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: The processor must return or destroy personal data at the end of term (of its agreement with the controller)
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Return or destroy data

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: The data subject has the right to receive the personal data concerning him or her, which he or she has provided to a controller, in a structured, commonly used and machine-readable format and has the right to transmit those data to another controller without hindrance from the controller to which the personal data have been provided.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Right of Data Portability

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: The data subject has the right to obtain erasure of their personal data
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Right of Erasure

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: The data subject shall have the right to obtain from the controller confirmation as to whether or not personal data concerning him or her are being processed, and, where that is the case, access to the personal data along with additional information about it.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Right to Access Personal Data

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: The right to basic information about processing provides data subjects with information about the processing activities involving their personal data
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Right to basic information about processing of personal data

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: The data subject has a right to not be evaluated through automated processing
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Right to not be evaluated through automated processing

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: The data subject has a right to object to direct marketting based on their personal data
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Right to object direct marketting

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: The data subject has the right to object to processing of their personal data
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Right to object processing

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: The data subject has a right to recitify their personal data
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Right to rectify

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: The data subject has the rights to restrict the processing of their personal data
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Right to restrict processing

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: The right to transparency requires controllers to provide information about the processing activities as well as personal data and its usage in a transparent manner
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Right to Transparency

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: The GDPR provides several rights to the data subjects which may be exercised at any time by the data subject and which are mandatory for the organisation to provide, comply with, and inform the data subject about.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Data Subject's Rights

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: The stated obligation could not be completed as it concerns freedoms protection.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Freedoms protection

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A seal pertaining to GDPR compliance
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Seal

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: GDPR provides for the creation and provision of seals and certificates pertaining to compliance or related activities
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Seals and Certifications

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Section in GDPR text
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Section

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: This activity refers to security of data subject's personal data.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Security of Personal Data

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Personal data revealing racial or ethnic origin, political opinions, religious or philosophical beliefs, or trade union membership, and the processing of genetic data, biometric data for the purpose of uniquely identifying a natural person, data concerning health or data concerning a natural person's sex life or sexual orientation.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Sensitive Personal Data

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: This activity represents the sharing of data subject's personal data with a third party.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Share Personal Data with Third Party

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: The provided copy of personal data should be in a commonly used format
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Copy should be in a commonly used format

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Obtained consent should be in a demonstrable form
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Demonstrable

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Obtained consent should be distinguishable from other related matters (in the context of the process)
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Distinguishable from other matters

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: The provided copy of personal data should be machine readable
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Copy should be in a machine readable format

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: The provided copy of personal data should be structured
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Should be structured

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: The provided copy of personal data should support reuse
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Shoud support reuse

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: GDPR obligation that specifies consent must be specific for it to be valid.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Specific

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: This obligation states that the collection of personal data should happen only for the specified purposes (for which the data subject has consented).
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Specified purpose

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: The principle of storage limitation states that personal data must be kept in a form which permits identification of data subjects for no longer than is necessary for the purposes for which the personal data are processed; personal data may be stored for longer periods insofar as the personal data will be processed solely for archiving purposes in the public interest, scientific or historical research purposes or statistical purposes in accordance with Article 89(1) of the GDPR subject to implementation of the appropriate technical and organisational measures required by this Regulation in order to safeguard the rights and freedoms of the data subject.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Principle of Storage Limitation

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: An activity where personal data is being stored
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Store Data

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: SubPoint in GDPR text
owl:Class.rdfs:label: SubPoint

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A sub-processor is a processor acting under another processor.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Sub-Processor

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Sub-processors must follow the same rules and obligations (or terms) as the agreement between processor and controller.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Follow same terms

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: This activity provides a systematic monitoring or overview of processes/activities taking place within the context of the organisation.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Systematic Monitoring

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Processing of personal data that is termed to be unlawful in the context of the GDPR or other relevant laws and regulations
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Unlawful Processing

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: An activity that uses personal data
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Use Data

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Consent is termed to be valid if it passes all the criteria or obligations laid down by the GDPR.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Valid Consent

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: These are obligations pertaining to the vital interests of the data subjects
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Vital Interests

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Consent must be obtained through the data subject's voluntary action and should be opt-in and not opt-out or by default.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Voluntary & Opt-in

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: The seals and certifications should be a voluntary system of accredition
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Voluntary accredition

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: This activity represents the data subject withdrawing given consent.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Withdrawing Given Consent

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: An ontology for representing provenance traces pertainining to GDPR compliance. It uses concepts from GDPRtEXT along with extending PROV and P-Plan.
